userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Winslow's Petition to the Orange County Court, 1748 May, Manuscript # 1983.3, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Petition of Richard Winslow to the Orange County {Va.} Court. Winslow claims that Robert and John Seayres have defrauded him of 1831 pounds of tobacco and he asks for N30 current money of Virginia in damages. Jury finds in his favor and awards him N13.1s.10p. George Wythe represents Winslow and the document is in Wythe's hand.
